wordDataArray.str: The best Poké Ball with the ultimate level of
performance. With it, you will catch any wild
Pokémon without fail.
An ultra-high-performance Poké Ball that provides
a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than
a Great Ball.
A good, high-performance Poké Ball that provides
a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than
a standard Poké Ball.
A device for catching wild Pokémon. It’s thrown like
a ball at a Pokémon, comfortably encapsulating
its target.
A special Poké Ball that is used only in the
Great Marsh. It is recognizable by the camouflage
pattern decorating it.
A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more
effective when attempting to catch Water- or
Bug-type Pokémon.
A somewhat different Poké Ball that works
especially well when catching Pokémon that
live underwater.
A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more
effective the lower the level of the wild Pokémon.
A somewhat different Poké Ball that works
especially well on a Pokémon species that has been
caught before.
A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes
progressively more effective at catching Pokémon
the more turns that are taken in battle.
A particularly comfortable Poké Ball that makes a
wild Pokémon quickly grow friendlier after
being caught.
A somewhat rare Poké Ball that was made as a
commemorative item used to celebrate an event of
some sort.
A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it
easier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark
places such as caves.
A remedial Poké Ball that restores the HP of a
Pokémon caught with it and eliminates any
status conditions.
A somewhat different Poké Ball that has a more
successful catch rate if used at the start of a
wild encounter.
A quite rare Poké Ball that has been crafted in
order to commemorate a special occasion of
some sort.
A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can
be used to restore 20 HP to a single Pokémon.
A spray-type medicine for treating poisoning. It can be
used to lift the effects of being poisoned from
a single Pokémon.
A spray-type medicine for treating burns. It can be
used to heal a single Pokémon suffering from a burn.
A spray-type medicine for treating freezing. It can be
used to thaw out a single Pokémon that has been
frozen solid.
A spray-type medicine to wake the sleeping. It can be
used to rouse a single Pokémon from the clutches
of sleep.
A spray-type medicine for treating paralysis. It can be
used to free a single Pokémon that has been paralyzed.
A spray-type medicine that can be used to fully restore
the HP of a single Pokémon and heal any status
conditions it has.
A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can
be used to completely restore the max HP of
a single Pokémon.
A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can
be used to restore 120 HP to a single Pokémon.
A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can
be used to restore 60 HP to a single Pokémon.
A spray-type medicine that is broadly effective.
It can be used to heal all the status conditions
of a single Pokémon.
A medicine that can be used to revive a single
Pokémon that has fainted. It also restores half of
the Pokémon’s max HP.
A medicine that can be used to revive a single
Pokémon that has fainted. It also fully restores
the Pokémon’s max HP.
Water with high mineral content. It can be used to
restore 30 HP to a single Pokémon.
A highly carbonated soda drink. It can be used to
restore 50 HP to a single Pokémon.
A very sweet and refreshing drink. It can be used to
restore 70 HP to a single Pokémon.
A bottle of highly nutritious milk. It can be used to
restore 100 HP to a single Pokémon.
A very bitter medicinal powder. It can be used to
restore 60 HP to a single Pokémon.
An extremely bitter medicinal root. It can be used to
restore 120 HP to a single Pokémon.
A very bitter medicinal powder. It can be used once
to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.
A terribly bitter medicinal herb. It revives a fainted
Pokémon and fully restores its max HP.
This medicine can be used to restore 10 PP to a single
selected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.
This medicine can be used to fully restore the PP of
a single selected move that has been learned by
a Pokémon.
This medicine can be used to restore 10 PP to each of
the moves that have been learned by a Pokémon.
This medicine can be used to fully restore the PP of all
of the moves that have been learned by a Pokémon.
Lavaridge Town’s local specialty. It can be used
once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.
A 100 percent pure juice made of Berries.
It can be used to restore 20 HP to a single Pokémon.
This rare ash can revive all fainted Pokémon in a
party. In doing so, it also fully restores their max HP.
A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed,
it raises the HP base points of a single Pokémon.
A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed,
it raises the Attack base points of a single Pokémon.
A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it
raises the Defense base points of a single Pokémon.
A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed,
it raises the Speed base points of a single Pokémon.
A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed,
it raises the Sp. Atk base points of a single Pokémon.
A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed,
it will instantly raise the level of a single Pokémon

A medicine that slightly raises the max PP of a single
selected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.
A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed,
it raises the Sp. Def base points of a single Pokémon.
A medicine that optimally raises the max PP of a single
selected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.
The Old Chateau’s hidden specialty. It can be used
once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.
An item that prevents stat reduction among the
Trainer’s party Pokémon for five turns after it is
used in battle.
An item that greatly raises the critical-hit ratio of
a Pokémon during a battle. It can be used only once

An item that sharply boosts the Attack stat of a
Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the
Pokémon is withdrawn.
An item that sharply boosts the Defense stat of a
Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the
Pokémon is withdrawn.
An item that sharply boosts the Speed stat of a
Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the
Pokémon is withdrawn.
An item that sharply boosts the accuracy of a
Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the
Pokémon is withdrawn.
An item that sharply boosts the Sp. Atk stat of a
Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the
Pokémon is withdrawn.
An item that sharply boosts the Sp. Def stat of a
Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the
Pokémon is withdrawn.
A doll that attracts the attention of a Pokémon.
It guarantees escape from any battle with
wild Pokémon.
A toy that attracts the attention of a Pokémon.
It guarantees escape from any battle with
wild Pokémon.
A flute made from blue glass. It awakens
sleeping Pokémon.
A flute made from yellow glass. It snaps Pokémon
out of confusion.
A flute made from red glass. It snaps Pokémon
out of infatuation.
A flute made from black glass. It makes it easier to
encounter strong Pokémon in the place you use it.
A flute made from white glass. It makes it easier to
encounter weak Pokémon in the place you use it.
Salt that you found inside Shoal Cave.
A seashell that you found inside Shoal Cave.
A small red shard. It appears to be a fragment of
some sort of implement made long ago.
A small blue shard. It appears to be a fragment of
some sort of implement made long ago.
A small yellow shard. It appears to be a fragment of
some sort of implement made long ago.
A small green shard. It appears to be a fragment of

An item that prevents any low-level wild Pokémon
from jumping out at you for a while. It lasts longer
than Repel.
An item that prevents any low-level wild Pokémon
from jumping out at you for a while. It lasts longer
than Super Repel.
A long and durable rope. Use it to escape instantly
from locations like caves or dungeons.
An item that prevents any low-level wild Pokémon
from jumping out at you for a while.
A peculiar stone that can make certain species of
Pokémon evolve. It burns as red as the evening sun.
A peculiar stone that can make certain species of
Pokémon evolve. It is as black as the night sky.
A peculiar stone that can make certain species of
Pokémon evolve. The stone has a fiery orange heart.
A peculiar stone that can make certain species of

A peculiar stone that can make certain species of

A peculiar stone that can make certain species of

A very small and rare mushroom. It’s popular with
a certain class of collectors.
A very large and rare mushroom. It’s popular with
a certain class of collectors.
A rather small pearl that has a very nice silvery
sheen to it. It can be sold at a low price to shops.
A rather large pearl that has a very nice silvery sheen.
It can be sold at a high price to shops.
Lovely red sand that flows between the fingers

A small shard of a beautiful gem that gives off
a distinctly red sparkle. It can be sold at a high price

A nugget of the purest gold that gives off a lustrous

A pretty, heart-shaped scale that is extremely
rare. Some people are happy to receive one.
A sweet honey with a lush aroma that attracts wild

A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears

A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears
to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and
has no effect.
A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears
to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and
has no effect.
A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears

A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived
in the sea. It looks as if it could be part of a
plant’s root.
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived
in the sea. It appears to be a fragment of a claw.
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived
in the sea. It might be a piece of a seashell.
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived

A piece of amber that still contains the genetic

A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived

A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived

A rare bone that is extremely valuable for the

A peculiar stone that can make certain species of
Pokémon evolve. It shines with a dazzling light.
A peculiar stone that can make certain species of

A peculiar stone that can make certain species of

A peculiar stone that can make certain species of

A vital item that is needed to keep a stone tower

it occasionally.
A glowing orb to be held by Giratina. It boosts the

Aromatic tea that has a slightly bitter taste.

The autograph you got from the Vermilion City Gym

A piece of cloyingly sweet chocolate.

A brightly gleaming orb to be held by Dialga.

A beautifully glowing orb to be held by Palkia.

An item to be held by a Pokémon. It casts a tricky

The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.

The target is blasted by a huge volume of water

A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to

The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force.

The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that
critical hits land more easily.
The user waggles a finger and stimulates its brain

The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
The user charges at the target and may make

The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its

The user drains the target’s blood. The user’s HP is

The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack.

The user creates a substitute for itself using some of

Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may

The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing
team’s feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch

The user rampages and attacks for two to three

The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack

The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
Using its tough and impressive horn, the user rams
into the target with no letup.
The user switches places with a party Pokémon in
waiting and passes along any stat changes.
The user compels the target to keep using the move

The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.

The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic
energy attacks the target.
The user attacks in an uproar for three turns.

The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on opposing

The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use

The user catches the target off guard and swaps its

The user attacks the target with great power.

The user employs its psychic power to exchange

The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit

The user lets loose a horribly echoing shout with

The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s

The user absorbs a mystical power from space to

The user attacks by shooting muddy water at opposing

The user hardens its body’s surface like iron,

The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.

The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its

The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword and

The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful

The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin.

Honey that Dynamax Vespiquen produces. Adding this
honey to Max Soup makes the taste very smooth. It also
has the same effect as a Max Revive.
Mushrooms that have the power of changing Dynamax
forms. They boost all stats of a Pokémon during battle.
A twig from a species of tree called Galarica that grows
in certain areas around the Galar region. It’s a material
for an accessory for a certain Pokémon.
A cuff made from woven-together Galarica Twigs.
Giving it to Galarian Slowpoke makes the
Pokémon very happy.
A card that increases the selection in boutiques and
hair salons.
A pass to go to the Isle of Armor. Show it to the rail
staff at Wedgehurst Station.
This bike can do a turbo boost and run on the water
using Rotom’s power. It’s a sparkling white that
shines brilliantly.
This bike can do a turbo boost and run on the water
using Rotom’s power. It’s a glistening black that
shines reddish-black.
A charm that increases the Exp. Points that Pokémon
can get. A machine-like object is inside the charm.
Rare ore that can be obtained on the Isle of Armor.
Something good will happen if you give it to a collector
on the Isle of Armor.
A mysterious and unique charm that increases the
chance of finding a Pokémon with a mark.
Reins that people presented to the king. They enhance
Calyrex’s power over bountiful harvests and unite
Calyrex with its beloved steed.
Reins that people presented to the king. They enable
those who are connected to communicate with each
other. The reins separate Calyrex and its beloved steed.
A wreath made from woven-together Galarica Twigs.
Placing it on the head of a Galarian Slowpoke makes
the Pokémon very happy.
A clue about the King of Bountiful Harvests. It’s written
by Peony, and an old photo is attached to it.
A clue about the legend of giants. It’s written
by Peony and has unique drawings.
A clue about the legend of bird Pokémon. It’s written
by Peony and has a unique drawing.
A mysterious clue that Peony seems to have dropped.
There’s a photo attached to it showing a shining hole
opening above the Max Lair.
A pass to go to the Crown Tundra. Show it to the rail
staff at Wedgehurst Station.
A mysterious object made of wood. Part of it seems to
be chipped. Maybe it’s meant to be part of something.
A single petal that the King of Bountiful Harvests
gave you. It radiates faint light.
Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful
Harvests’ beloved steed, Glastrier. The hair is strong
and very flexible.
Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful
Harvests’ beloved steed, Spectrier. The hair is very
smooth to the touch.
Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved
steed likes to eat. It grew in a field covered in snow.
Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved
steed likes to eat. It grew in a gloomy field.
Mysterious ore that can be obtained in the Max Lair.
Something good will happen if you give it to a
collector in the Crown Tundra.
Seeds to plant in a field. The kind of carrot you’ll get is
determined by which field you plant the seeds in.
A patch that allows a Pokémon with a regular Ability
to have a rare Ability.
Cords that shine when you hold them up to the light.
The people of old times presented these to the King of
Bountiful Harvests to express their gratitude.
A small shard that emanates an enigmatic power.
Inside the shard, you can see a pattern that looks like
Ramanas roses.
A large shard that emanates an enigmatic power.
Inside the shard, you can see a pattern that looks like
Ramanas roses.
A single-use drill to bore a hole in the wall for your
Secret Base.
This item, when held by a Pokémon,
allows it to earn EXP gained from defeating a Pokémon,
regardless of if it was used in battle or not.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Johto Room at
Renegade Park.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Soul Room at
Renegade Park.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Rainbow Room
at Renegade Park.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Squall Room at
Renegade Park.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Oceanic Room
at Renegade Park.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Tectonic Room
at Renegade Park.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Stratospheric
Room at Renegade Park.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Genome Room
at Renegade Park.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Discovery Room
at Renegade Park.
A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel
a strong connection between it and the Distortion Room
at Renegade Park.
A music player that allows you to listen to nostalgic
songs. It’s operated with the flip of a single switch.
A mysterious Ball.
This item makes you think of the forest.
A mysterious invitation given to you by
a Dragonite. It says to meet somebody
at the Gate.
A mysterious bag of candies.
This item seems inexhaustible.
The Wind badge, acquired from Heather.
This item does absolutely nothing.
The Fang badge, acquired from Wyver.
This badge is totally useless really.
The Acid badge, acquired from Slythe.
This badge is just a pretty token.
The Shadow badge, acquired from Shade.
A reminder of the impending darkness, apparently.
The General badge, acquired from Gene.
A token of victory over plain, but dangerous foes.
The Moon badge, acquired from Luna.
A memento, as beautiful as the moon itself.
A strange, silvery feather that sparkles.
A small incense burner shaped like a Pokémon from Sinnoh's myths.
When filled with flowers, strange Pokémon stir.
A suit of armor, perfectly molded to Mewtwo’s form.
It seems to keep the Pokémon’s powers in check.
A repel that never runs out, keep Pokémon away forever.
This item does not work with the repel trick.
An old suit of armor, molded to Mewtwo’s form.
It seems to keep the Pokémon’s powers in check.
